blocks.text: A load balancer is a device or software that acts as a "traffic cop," distributing incoming network traffic across multiple servers (a server farm) to ensure **no single server gets overloaded**, thus improving **application performance, reliability, and availability**. It uses algorithms (like round robin or least connections) to intelligently route requests, performs health checks to avoid unhealthy servers, and can be hardware, software, or cloud-based, essential for handling high traffic in modern applications.
A load balancer is a tool or system that distributes incoming traffic (usersâ€™ requests) across multiple servers so that **no single server gets overloaded.**
